INTELSAT H satellites (F-2 and F-4) were employed for service in the Pacific area. During the time when the F-4 satellite was undergoing final positioning maneu足 vers, its longitude was allowed to approach closely that of F-2 for the purpose of making intersystem interference measurements. At Paumalu, the 26-meter (85-foot) antenna was operating with F-2 while the 13-meter (42-foot) antenna was available for experimental work with F-4. Experiments and measurements of interference were made as the satellites approached to within 0.50 of each other. It was concluded from these interference measurements that the INTEISAT II system can be safely operated with a minimum of 1.60 of longitude separation between satellites.
